ALLEGATION: It is alleged that Youth A has a black eye, bruised forehead,
bruise under his eye, bruise on his chest, and cuts and scratches on his
hands. It is alleged a staff member caused these injuries.
INVESTIGATION:
On 9/16/21, I spoke to Administrator 1. We discussed the allegations and
documentation needed.
On 9/16/21, I spoke to DHHS Social Service Worker. Allegations and scheduling were
discussed.
2

The following documents were reviewed throughout the course of the investigation:
 Incident reports
 Nurse Notes
All interviews were conducted face to face at the facility with DHHS Social Service
Worker.
I reviewed the Incident Report dated 9/13/21 at 2:30pm.
…While outside [Youth A] and his peer got into an altercation and was separated
by staff…
I reviewed the Incident Report dated 9/15/21 at 12:18pm.
[Youth A] ran off campus…towards abandoned house picking up a large piece of
glass. [Youth A] stated he wanted to stab staff and attempted to run down the
street…staff was able to catch up to him …secure the glass but [Youth A] had cut
himself prior to staff getting to him…
I reviewed the Nurse Note for 9/15/21. Youth A’s middle finger was cut; peroxide and
triple antibiotic ointment and covered with a band aid.
I reviewed the Incident report dated 9/15/21 at 2:55pm.
While in the supine restraint…he repeatedly threw his face/head into staff knee…
I reviewed the Incident Report for 9/15/21 at 6:26pm.
[Youth A] broke into the administration building…destroyed the parlor turning
over tables and chairs…[Youth A] piked up the television remote and tried to throw the
remote into the television. As staff went to retrieve the remote from [Youth A], his hand
was bleeding…
I reviewed the Nurse Note for 9/16/21 at 8:00am.
…Child was asked about his mark on his forehead and around his eye…child
had a noted red mark on his forehead and some dark marks around his eyes…
We interviewed Staff 1. Staff 1 reported Youth A became physically aggressive while
leaving school on 9/15/21. Youth A began kicking and punching staff. Staff 1 reported
she restrained Youth A with Staff 2. Staff 1 reported they follow TCI (Therapeutic Crisis
Intervention) restraint model. Staff 1 reported it was a good restraint with no issues in
placing the proper holds on Youth A. Staff 1 reported when Youth A was on the ground,
he was still violent and was moving his head back and forth, hitting his head on her
knee. Staff 1 reported she had his right arm and placed her knees under his arm and
3

above his arm; therefore, one of her knees were in range to be hit by his head. Staff 1
reported Youth A was cussing and threatening them.
We interviewed Staff 2. Staff 2 reported Youth A was restrained inside the school. Staff
2 reported during the restraint, Youth A was banging his head against their knees. Staff
2 reported, they then were able to let him up form the restraint. Staff 2 reported Youth A
became aggressive again and started to use profanity towards other youth and staff.
Youth A then attempted to hit other kids and staff. Staff 2 reported they were able to get
him out of the classroom and outside. Once outside, Staff 2 reported Youth A began
biting and hitting staff. Staff 2 reported they restrained Youth A on the grass. Youth A
began to bang his head back and forth against their knees. Staff 2 reported they were
on the grass, so this did cause some movement or sliding. Staff 2 reported he did not
see anyone hurt Youth A. Staff 2 reported Youth A stated they were hurting his legs
when he was on the ground, so they reestablished their hold on his legs. Staff 2
reported Youth A never complained about anything else hurting. Staff 2 reported Youth
A later got into a physical fight with a peer. During that fight he had bruising under his
eye and did bang his head on the door.
DHHS Social Service Worker interviewed Youth A at McLaren Hospital in Flint, MI.
Youth A reported that he was in the hospital because he had thoughts of suicide. Youth
A reported he had a piece of glass and attempted to cut himself. Youth A reported the
injury on his forehead is self-inflicted. Youth A reported he hit his head and then
scratched at it. Youth A reported the black mark under his eye is from his older brother
in June of 2021. Youth A reported the mark never went away. Youth A reported he has
an injury to his left side of his face due to a restraint he was in with Staff 1. Youth A
reported Staff 1 hit his face with her knee. Youth A reported it happened quickly and no
one else saw it.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.159 Resident restraint.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies
and
procedures regarding restraint. These policies and
procedures shall be available to all residents, their families,
and referring agencies.
ANALYSIS: Youth A was physically aggressive during his restraint. Staff 1
and Staff 2 both reported a textbook restraint, other than Youth
A banging his head on their knees. Youth A was in a physical
fight with another peer and was self-harming himself prior to the
restrain in question. Youth A reported that neither staff caused
the eye bruising or the mark on his forehead. There are no
injuries noted from the hospital concerning bruises on chest.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
4
